org.ietf.nea.pb.serialize.reader.bytebuffer

Class PbMessageReasonStringValueReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ietf.nea.pb.serialize.reader.bytebuffer.PbMessageReasonStringValueReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Reader<PbMessageValueReasonString,ByteBuffer>, TnccsReader<PbMessageValueReasonString>

     class PbMessageReasonStringValueReader
extends Object
implements TnccsReader<PbMessageValueReasonString>
    Reader to parse a TNCCS reason string message value compliant to RFC 5793 from a buffer of bytes to a Java object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private PbMessageValueReasonStringBuilder baseBuilder 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PbMessageReasonStringValueReader(PbMessageValueReasonStringBuilder builder)
      Creates the reader with a corresponding builder to validate the parsed values and build the message value.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte getMinDataLength()
      Returns the minimal data length, that is needed to get a result (e.g. at least a number of bytes for a header is needed to parse something).
      PbMessageValueReasonString read(ByteBuffer buffer, long messageLength)
      Reads a number (length) of bytes from the source and parses it to a Java object.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public PbMessageValueReasonString read(ByteBuffer buffer,
                              long messageLength)
                                throws SerializationException,
                                       ValidationException
        Description copied from interface: Reader
        Reads a number (length) of bytes from the source and parses it to a Java object. The length may be ignored if the reader contains an implemented fixed length or the length is dependent of the data being parsed.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Reader<PbMessageValueReasonString,ByteBuffer>
        Parameters:
        buffer - the data source
        messageLength - the number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the parsed Java object
        Throws:
        SerializationException - if parsing or reading fails
        ValidationException - if the parsed data is not valid and a Java object cannot be constructed
